entries.meaning: (uncountable) The science of dating samples of rock or sediment.
examples: Geochronology allows us to see more precisely how the world has evolved.

entries.meaning: (countable) Any one of the methods by which the age of different samples of rock can be determined.
examples: The history of the East–Antarctic shield has been uncovered through uranium–lead geochronology.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The division of ancient time into named subdivisions / periods
